About Me

Hello, my name is Sundar and I am a tech-savvy Product Manager who has: road mapped, gathered and managed product requirements; developed products, applications and learnt from their success and failures; focused on problem space by leveraging technical instincts and capabilities with business acumen and domain knowledge.

I am most skilled in: Building Products, Requirements Management, Analysis and Problem solving, and Domain Consulting.

Education

University of Madras

http://www.unom.ac.in/

Bachelor of Engineering in Electrical and Electronics

2000 - 2004

From Wikipedia: University of Madras is a public state university in Chennai (formerly Madras), Tamil Nadu, India. Established in 1857, it is one of the third oldest universities in India immediately after University of Calcutta and University of Mumbai .The university was incorporated by an act of the Legislative Council of India. University of Madras is the alma mater of two Indian Physics Nobel Laureates, CV Raman and Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar, five Presidents of India, including A.P.J. Abdul Kalam, and several notable mathematicians including Srinivasa Ramanujan.

During my time at University I learnt most of my key skills that have I have taken through my career such as analysis, and collaboration. I thouroughly enjoyed my time at university and learnt a lot.

Commentary

1. The Client had migrated their primary platform applicaiton from legacy to latest technologies. While that was completed, the corections department was still on the legacy, as it needed customized solutions on the new platform for every department. The legacy corrections solution was bringing in size-able revenue (15% of the total annual revenue). So, we built a platform where UIs and underlying interactions can be built on the go and deployed at sites without a need for release.

2. Similar to corrections solution, another applicaiton residing on older technology needed a migration. The caveat: It had the highest ever NPS and also was bringing in annual revenue of over $30M. The migration strategy needed to be constructed carefully so that it does not impact the customers migrating, and also has the least impact on learning. After extensive UX research and many interviews later, we are on the cusp of releasing a product that will be superior to the Classic - and are hoping that we do not pull a Windows Vista 😉.

3. The new platform is a giant with millions of daily transaction. In order to understand the workflow of users and customers, I had built reports using Elastic DSL queries on Kibana platform. Also, in order to troubleshoot issues reported by customers, AWS logs were queried to undertand their problems.
